Event: Implementation of the New Zealand Zero Carbon Act
Description: The Zero Carbon Act comes into force, setting New Zealand on a path to net-zero emissions by 2050, impacting the NZ ETS.

Event: Swiss ETS linked to EU ETS

Event: CCA Price Floor Increase in California
Description: California increases the price floor for CCAs, providing greater price certainty but also increasing compliance costs.

Event: Introduction of Market Stabilization Measures in Korea ETS
Description: South Korea implements market stabilization measures in the KAU market to address price volatility.

Event: Introduction of Auctioning in NZ ETS
Description: Auctioning is introduced in the New Zealand Emissions Trading Scheme, allowing the government to control the supply of NZUs and impacting market prices.

Event: Launch of Phase 4 of the EU ETS
Description: The beginning of Phase 4 of the EU ETS, with stricter emission reduction targets and updated allocation rules, impacting carbon prices.

Event: Start of Phase 3 of the Korea ETS
Description: Phase 3 of the Korea ETS begins, introducing stricter caps and new sectors, affecting KAU prices.

Event: Integration of Hubei Market into the National ETS
Description: Hubeiâ€™s carbon market is integrated into Chinaâ€™s national ETS, leading to changes in allowance prices and trading volumes.

Event: China national ETS operation
Description: No description provided.

Event: ACCU Price Surge Due to Corporate Demand
Description: ACCU prices surge as corporate demand for carbon offsets increases, driven by net-zero commitments and expecations for policy changes to increase compliance demand.

Event: ACCU Price drop as liquidity moves from government led purchases the secondary market
Description: ACCU prices surge as corporate demand for carbon offsets increases, driven by net-zero commitments and expecations for policy changes to increase compliance demand.

Event: EU ETS Price Surge
Description: Carbon prices in the EU ETS reach record highs due to tightening supply and increased energy prices.

Event: Inclusion of Maritime Shipping in the EU ETS
Description: The EU ETS is expanded to include emissions from maritime shipping, increasing demand for allowances.

Event: Revisions to Free Allocation Rules in NZ ETS
Description: Changes to the free allocation rules are implemented, affecting the number of NZUs allocated to emissions-intensive, trade-exposed industries.

Event: Tightening of Australia's emissions compliance scheme - the Safeguard Mechanism
Description: The Australian government reforms its Safeguard Mechanism, tightening emission limits for large emitters.

Event: Expansion of KAU Coverage to New Sectors
Description: The Korean ETS expands to include additional industrial sectors, impacting the demand for KAUs.

Event: Introduction of China's National ETS Phase 2
Description: China transitions to Phase 2 of its national ETS, expanding coverage to additional industries.

Event: Global Coal Phase-Out Agreement at COP26
Description: An international agreement is reached to phase out coal power, significantly impacting global carbon markets.

Event: European Commission Announces European Green Deal
Description: The announcement of the European Green Deal aimed at making the EU climate-neutral by 2050, leading to significant impacts on carbon markets and financial sectors tied to renewable energy and sustainability.

Event: China Announces Carbon Neutrality Target by 2060
Description: Chinaâ€™s pledge to become carbon neutral by 2060 influenced global carbon markets and signaled potential shifts in energy investments.

Event: Russian Invasion of Ukraine
Description: The invasion led to severe disruptions in global energy markets, with significant impacts on EU carbon prices and a shift towards energy independence within Europe.

Event: EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) Adoption
Description: The European Union formally adopts the CBAM, impacting global trade by requiring importers to buy carbon certificates for emissions related to goods.

Event: KAU Volatility due to colder SK winter
Description: South Korea saw increased energy demand in early 2018, especially during colder months, leading to higher emissions from power generation. Coinciding with the complaince deadline in June 2018,  this saw greater speculation and price volaility as participants expected increased demand for KAUs as power companies had to purchase more allowances to cover their emissions.

Event: Multiple deadly heat waves hit East Asia + Monsoon flood in India where Kerala state reported 500 deaths
Description: No description provided.

Event: European Cold Wave Impacting Energy Demand
Description: A severe cold wave across Europe significantly increased heating demand, leading to higher carbon emissions and increased EU ETS allowance prices.

Event: Drought in Northern Europe Reduces Hydropower Production
Description: A prolonged drought in Northern Europe led to reduced hydropower generation, increasing reliance on fossil fuels and driving up EU ETS carbon prices.

Event: 2023 European Heatwave Impacting Nuclear and Coal Power Generation
Description: A severe heatwave affected the cooling capacities of nuclear and coal power plants across Europe, leading to increased carbon intensity and higher EU ETS prices.

Event: 2024 European Heatwave Impacting Energy and Carbon Prices
Description: A significant heatwave in Europe leads to increased energy demand and higher carbon prices in the EU ETS.
